ARABIC: قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّى فِيهِ رَبِّى خَيْرٌ فَأَعِينُونِى بِقُوَّةٍ أَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُمْ رَدْمًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'The power my Lord has granted me is better than that. Just give me a strong helping hand and I will build a solid barrier between you and them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He said: "The ability my Lord has given me is better. So help me with your manual labour; I will build a wall between you and them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: He answered: "Whatever my Lord has granted me is good enough. But help me with your labour and I will erect a rampart between you and them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He replied, "The power that my Lord has granted me is better (than your tax). Help me with your man-power and I shall construct a barrier between you and Gog and Magog.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “That which my Lord has given me control over is better, therefore help me with strength – I shall set up a barrier between you and them.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "That in which my Lord had established me is better. So help me with strength, I will erect between you and them a barrier."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: That in which my Lord has established me is better, therefore you only help me with workers, I will make a fortified barrier between you and them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'That wherein my Lord has established me is better; so aid me forcefully, and I will set up a rampart between you and between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: That wherein my Lord hath established me is better (than your tribute). Do but help me with strength (of men), I will set between you and them a bank.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He said, "What My Lord has given me is better [than any tribute]. Help me with a force of labourers and I will erect a barrier between you and them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: better is that where in my Lord hath established me; so help me with might, and I shall place between you and them a rampart.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘What my Lord has furnished me is better. Yet help me with some strength, and I will make a bulwark between you and them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He said: "(The power) in which my Lord has established me is better (than tribute): Help me therefore with strength (and labour): I will erect a strong barrier between you and them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He said: "That (wealth, authority and power) in which my Lord had established me is better (than your tribute). So help me with strength (of men), I will erect between you and them a barrier.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He replied: 'That which my Lord has given me is better, therefore help me with all your power, and I will build a barrier between you and between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “What my Lord has empowered me with is better. But assist me with strength, and I will build between you and them a dam.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:95] He said, ‘That, wealth and so on, wherewith my Lord has empowered me (makkannī, a variant reading has makkananī) is better, than the tribute that you offer me, and so I have no need for it. I shall build for you the barrier without [demanding] a fee; so help me with strength, in that which I [will] demand from you, and I will build between you and them a rampart, a fortified barricade.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said: That wherein my Lord hath established me) the dominion that my Lord has given me is (better) than your reward or wage. (Do but help me with strength) they said: "which strength do you want from us" and he said: "the strength of blacksmiths", (I will set between you and them a bank) a barrier.
